extension.summary: inadyn: is a free DynDNS client
extension.description: INADYN is a free DynDNS client. It gives the possibility to have your own fixed hostname registered on the internet, although your IP might be changing. Supports the following dynamic DNS services: dyndns.org (in all three flavors: dynamic, static, custom), freedns.afraid.org, zoneedit.com, no-ip.com, dnsomatic.com

Democracy Now! is a syndicated program of news, analysis, and opinion aired by more than 700 radio and television, satellite and cable TV networks in North America. Democracy Now! serves as the flagship program for the Pacifica Radio network.

extension.disclaimer: I do not host any of the online video, audio, and photo files that some of the add-ons link to stored on third-party websites, nor do they upload such files themselves. They are not responsible for what other people upload to any third-party sites. Therefore we urge all copyright owners, to recognize that the links contained within these add-ons are located somewhere else on the web. The scraped embedded links point to the location of each video on the web. Please direct all copyright infringement issues to the companies that host these files :- Google, Dailymotion, Veoh, and so forth.

extension.summary: Universal feed parser, handles RSS 0.9x, RSS 1.0, RSS 2.0, CDF, Atom 0.3, and Atom 1.0 feeds
extension.description:
Universal feed parser
Handles RSS 0.9x, RSS 1.0, RSS 2.0, CDF, Atom 0.3, and Atom 1.0 feeds
Visit http://feedparser.org/ for the latest version Visit http://feedparser.org/docs/ for the latest documentation
Required: Python 2.4 or later Recommended: CJKCodecs and iconv_codec http://cjkpython.i18n.org/
Watch movie trailers available on IMDb.
Download and install add-ons from the unofficial queeup's addon repository.
Download and install add-ons from the unofficial queeup's addon repository.

extension.description: NewsLook - bringing you the best video news.

extension.summary: Requests is an ISC Licensed HTTP library, written in Python, for human beings.
extension.description: Most existing Python modules for sending HTTP requests are extremely verbose and cumbersome. Python's builtin urllib2 module provides most of the HTTP capabilities you should need, but the api is thoroughly broken. It requires an enormous amount of work (even method overrides) to perform the simplest of tasks.
